contentrichtext.text: {{Coord|44|24|25|N|43|52|50|E|display=title}} '''Zelenokumsk''' ({{lang-ru|Зеленоку́мск}}) is a [[types of inhabited localities in Russia|town]] and the [[administrative center]] of [[Sovetsky District, Stavropol Krai|Sovetsky District]] of [[Stavropol Krai]], [[Russia]], located on the [[Kuma River, Russia|Kuma River]]. Population: {{ru-census|p2010=35,839|p2002=40,340|p1989=35,140}} ==History== It was founded in 1762 as the ''[[village#Russia|selo]]'' of '''Vorontsovo-Alexandrovskoye''' ({{lang|ru|Воронцово-Александровское}}). It was granted [[urban-type settlement|work settlement]] status in 1963 and renamed '''Sovetskoye'''. Town status was granted to it in 1965 when it was renamed Zelenokumsk. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Stavropol Krai}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2012}} [[Category:Cities and towns in Stavropol Krai]] [[Category:Populated places established in 1762]]
